intro: Trachyandra, commonly known as the "rough-leaved daisies," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa, particularly in regions like South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. Trachyandra species are characterized by their distinctive, often hairy or rough-textured leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. They typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
